title: Give players who play 75% or more games as solo players a special banner to signify their ability.
body: So it would be like an add on to the gold or plat banner. Sort of like a mastery or teamwork banner as well.. Idk. What you think?

replies.body: what if instead we, solo players, gained more LP? I think that baddies getting carried do win less LP per victory and loose more as well, but if you break LP gain down in a bar (as IP gain does with boosts) solo players could gauge the fairness of the whole issue better.

Sorry, that's just a terrible idea.

BobbyBoosted plays with his friends to get from Bronze 5 to Diamond 5. BobbyBoosted then decides to play the game without his friends, since he's now a big bad Diamond 5! He utterly fails, going 0/30/0, but because he's "solo" that game, he loses less LP than the duo he's matched with, despite costing them the game?

Duoing with my wife we maintain about a 50% win rate. We deserve to fall in down from high bronze/low silver because we play together, while 0/13/0 solo top lane player we had a while back deserve to climb more than us?

Ip and mac adress block should be easy to implement in LoL (as Steam or ArcGames does for exemple)

People playing from too much different IP's and Mac should give explanations or they will simply get banned.
Boosters always log in with a vpn and on different pc, that's why such a system should be impemented to make the game fair for everyone.

But again, there are a lot of problems in LoL, scripts for exemple. Riot (with lot of millions of $$$) are too bad to stop the 3th party software, they could encrypt all the assets and make the memory unreadable, take away all client sided things and make them server sided.

IP bans are a terrible idea, as banning one IP for one player can ban out thousands. The university close to where I live has one external IP address (which is what Riot would see for anyone living on campus) and enrolls 4,000 freshmen annually. Most of the freshmen live on campus, so they'd be prevented from joining the game or continuing to play.

Mac Addresses can be spoofed as well, making them not so reliable for banning an individual.

Boosting services have been switching to using Dynamic Queue as well, having several high ranked players create smurfs and play with the person being boosted. It's entirely fine by Riot's policies, as there's no punishment for creating a smurf, no punishment for playing with new "friends", and no punishment for paying said "friends" to play with you.

Your hyperbole has a lot of flaws and I'll explain them:

-It doesn't matter if you begin in bronze and queue up with your friends until you're diamond, your MMR adjusts with your wins/looses, meaning that it doesn't matter if you're in Diamond, if your MMR is super low (**Which already happens if you climb by getting carried with your friends**), you'll queue against plats, golds and if low enough even silvers.

-Currently, you playing with your wife in fact gives you less LP, unless of course your MMRs are close to the same number, in that case yes, the penalty of duoing is almost zero but you can't deny that you play worse when you're not with her, meaning that your solo skill is lower, so it'd be harder for you to climb ranked if you're alone either way and guess what, a LOT of people play alone and it's harder for us to climb because we don't have a buddy covering our backs. So yes it should be harder for you to climb if you have an eternal duo, because either way if you played alone it'd be harder as well, you're just hacking the system by playing with someone else.

-breaking down LP gain will only reveal a lot of things that goes unnoticed, you wouldn't fall down into bronze but it'd be harder for you to climb up, imagine two players with the same MMR and skill level, maybe it takes the duo player a week and a half to climb from gold 5 to gold 4, while it takes a solo player almost a month to climb from gold 5 to gold 4, how is that fair?

1. With your system, BobbyBoosted would lose less LP for playing solo than he would with his friends. That's the exact opposite of what you want to have happen with a boosted player, you want them to keep playing with their friends so they don't ruin someone else's game. Gaining more per win and losing less per loss will result in him staying at a higher rank for longer than he should after he leaves his premade.

2. When I've wanted to climb faster, I've played more solo ranked games. Playing with my wife guarantees one fewer idiot on my team, but drags down the MMR enough that I get matched with more idiots as a whole. Same situation as last year, nothing unique to Dynamic Queue about that. It's not easier to win together, it's just better to play together.

3. From my own personal experience, I think you vastly overestimate the climbing potential of Duos. I think my own experience points to those estimates being backwards.

actually, they just need another ranking beside the actual one.

Lp/ranked ladder is what define your ability to climb while you focus on teamplay, it stay as it is now with the end season reward and stuff (because being good at teamplay stuff, either you do them or react to them, is imo what should be first rated in a team oriented game)

next to that, it the end game screen, if they could add a fourth  point system (lp, mastery point, ip and "new unit") based on your succes against team organisation (win more if solo against a higher mr premade, win less if full premade against full solo, with the opossite in case of a loss) that would rate the individual level of a player (the ability to show how you can 1v9, root of the problem here) without hurting the actual ladder

Well I think that adding another ranking system would make things a bit more complicated... mainly because there's no way to gauge where you belong, say you are silver on solo and platinum on team, what's you real ranking then? gold? both?

Also, solo players are going to have a huge hole on team rank and it'll carve into them just like the current system does :S

I think that the current system does a good job at calculating what it has always calculated, but it does an awful job portraying it

I would say both are your actual ranking (and to avoid confusion, maybe don't use the bronze/silver/... stuff for both ranking but create a whole new one for personnal impact stuff)

You can be good in team but bad solo, so you probably wont climb the solo ranking high, both result leading to your true value.
The same is also true for the opposite, you can be good solo, but not that great at impacting the result of the match as a team so you wont climb fast in the actual ranked system, but a 50/50 winrate will make you climb second ladder faster than a premade

This doesn't affect anything.
Wrong, it may have negative effect on your ladder.

Your hidden MMR will raise at the same time, but your rank will advance faster and as a result you will get less LP.

Higher MMR + Low rank = More LP
Low MMR + High rank = Less LP

Something that if for example, if I played the majority of my games without a duo or otherwise premade, and won atleast 60% of those games, then I would get a crest or something on the bottom of the loading screen card showing this.

It could have tiers like mastery level.

Tier one would be for about 30% and would be bronze.

Tier two would be for 40% and would be silver.

Tier three would be for 50% and would be gold.

Tier four would be 60% and would be platinum.

Tier five would be 70% and would be diamond.

You would have to reach each percentage for that season to gain that tier for the crest.

This would help give people something to work towards and would show their skills as a solo player.
